title: Social Learning Instructional Design Scenarios to Improve MOOC Completion Rates in Technical Subjects Using Wearable Technology

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational technical subject knowledge, online learning experience, and basic understanding of social interaction and teamwork
context.additional_context: For working professionals aiming to strengthen technical competencies. Establishes hands-on learning environments using wearable technologies (e.g., smartwatches, fitness trackers). Integrates social contexts like citizen participation, rights awareness, and institutional support mechanisms into the learning process.

learning_goals: Learners complete over 80% of practical assignments using wearable technology to enhance technical application skills and collaborative competencies.
Learners maintain over 90% weekly learning participation through a real-time feedback system and strengthen relationships with peer learners.
Through project-based assessments, learners propose ways to apply MOOC-learned technical subject content to real work environments and develop implementation strategies considering social impact.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
